factText: David Muir has an update on the severe weather outbreak that left at least 34 dead across the Southeast, with more than 90 reported tornadoes, including an EF-4 that was on the ground in Mississippi for 60 miles.

determined 13 #tornadoes touched down in the @FOX19 viewing area. NWS Tallahassee determined that an EF1 tornado touched down on the 13th just west of TyTy. Wednesday morning, the National Weather Service in Jackson confirmed two long-track tornadoes ripped through the state.
More than a million homes and businesses were left without power, according to local reports. At least 33 dead, half a million without power after storms, tornadoes batter South - National News

EASTER TORNADO UPDATE: Six tornadoes have now been confirmed across Central Mississippi from the Easter Sunday tornado outbreak. The Easter Sunday/Monday storm system produced over 70 tornadoes!!!. This brings the total #ArLaMsWx #tornado count from #Easter Sunday to nine across five different parishes (Ouachita, Bienville, Richland, Morehouse, West Carroll).
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-016_Tornado_Are meteorologists predicting more tornadoes following {event}?

factText: It’s Tornado and Severe Weather Awareness Week in Wisconsin and Fond du Lac Fire Rescue with some help from Fox 11 Green Bay talked with Tulsa, Oklahoma Undersheriff and former Oklahoma State Patrol Captain George Brown about severe weather preparation and what you can do to keep safe when severe weather approaches: https://fox11online.com/good-day-wi/ok-undersheriff-shares-advice-as-we-head-into-severe-weather-season

NWS Chief Meteorologist on scene Monday afternoon estimated the winds in our tornado to be 135-140 mph after his survey. Long Track Tornado Path length of 24.04 miles EF 3 Tornado with wind speed up to 165mph (EF 4 begins at 166 mph). Sunday's Walthall County tornado has been upgraded to EF-4 with an estimated peak wind of 170 mph. He is officially confirming a strong F1 bordering F2 tornado in Greene County on Monday morning with maximum winds of 105 MPH.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-016_Tornado_What was the estimated wind speed of the tornado?

factText: Move to higher ground if flooding threatens your area. In an effort to offer much needed relief to those suffering during this pandemic, the 36th Air Evacuation Squadron takes to the sky.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-016_general_Are evacuation orders still in place or have they been lifted?

factText: The tornado crossed the Alabama/Georgia border at EF-1 strength downing numerous trees along Michaels Road/Brown Gap Cemetery road before destroying the pillars in front of a house and causing additional damage to the roof.
"NWS storm surveys have confirmed 77 tornadoes thus far from the Sunday-Monday (April 12-13) tornado outbreak. The Easter Weekend tornado outbreak had at least 77 confirmed tornadoes.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-016_Tornado_Are there any reports of multiple tornadoes forming during {event}?

factText: Alabama, Louisiana and Mississippi all declared a state of emergency in response to the storms which included several powerful tornadoes.
Latest Updates After Tornadoes Hit South Carolina, Louisiana, Mississippi: Death Toll Rises as Severe Weather Sweeps South

United Way of Northeast Louisiana has established a Tornado Relief Fund for those impacted by the tornado in the Monroe area over the weekend. The Salvation Army Walker County Alabama is now serving hot meals from their canteen in response to Sunday's tornado. Our Samaritan’s Purse U.S. Disaster Relief team has arrived in four states to help provide physical relief to these families after dozens of tornadoes.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-016_Tornado_What emergency shelters are open specifically for tornado victims?

factText: The river was from 2 to 4 feet above flood stage Tuesday throughout much of Iowa, Illinois and Missouri, and the National Weather Service has warned of a high risk of flooding through May. Constant flooding is destroying communities along the Upper Mississippi River, it's not the only one. For example, Hannibal, Missouri, Mark Twain’s hometown, has seen seven of the 10 worst floods on record since 2000. Extreme flooding has become more common along the Mississippi.

Drax Biomass donates $30,000 to help communities affected by COVID-19 and Easter tornadoes -- https://bit.ly/3adMykd:=:https://www.myarklamiss.com/news/local-news/drax-biomass-donates-30000-to-help-communities-affected-by-covid-19-and-easter-tornadoes/ #LocalNews #Community. Y’all have probably noticed we’ve been focusing a lot of attention on the relief efforts for the Easter tornadoes.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-016_general_What volunteer efforts are currently active for {event}?

factText: Yellow areas were under severe thunderstorm warnings. NWS Alert> Strong Thunderstorm 11 Miles W of Mayo Moving E At 40 MPH.

Tornado reports are the red triangles, with orange boxes indicating all the tornado warnings that were issued. As of this morning, there have been 7 EF-3s, 13 EF-2s, 36 EF-1s, and 21 EF-0s tornadoes confirmed. This is the 4th F/EF-4 tornado ever in the NWS New Orleans forecast area. There are now 16 confirmed tornadoes in Georgia from Sunday's outbreak. Live coverage: NWS reports 13 radar confirmed tornadoes in Mississippi, N. Louisiana

Rep. Steven Palazzo (R-MS) and Rep. Michael Guest (R-MS) say they are ready to help with local efforts as assessments continue following a deadly tornado on Easter Sunday. In times of crisis, it is important for us to come together to help our neighbors in need, and that is exactly what has happened in communities all across the state of Mississippi this week after tornadoes devastated areas near our Laurel, Collins and McComb operations on Easter Sunday.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-016_general_What actions are being taken by law enforcement to ensure safety during {event}?

factText: Next Tuesday: Severe storms are possible starting on Tuesday from Texas-Oklahoma-Kansas-Colorado.
Cleanup continues in Mississippi after tornadoes tore through the state earlier this week, leaving behind a trail of destruction.

On the Easter Sunday Outbreak, the tornado started its tear on the south side of Jefferson Davis County, causing severe damage to homes and trees near the Bassfield area. Scouts identified approximately 260 poles, 600 spans of wire and 75 transformers as damaged or needing repair across our service area after storms and tornadoes swept through Easter Sunday. * At least 90 chicken houses in Mississippi were destroyed by tornadoes on Easter Sunday.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-016_Tornado_How many structures were completely destroyed due to {event}?

factText: The tornado moved northeastward and carved a nearly 68-mile-long path that had a maximum width of 2 miles. The damage path went approximately 68 miles, and the width of the tornado was 2 miles, breaking the old record of 1.75 miles. Preliminary survey results from the NWS determined that the first tornado was an EF-4, tracked about 68 miles, and was 2 miles wide!. New preliminary survey data suggest the tornado reached a width of 2 miles wide and was on the ground for 68 miles.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-016_Tornado_What was the path length and width of the tornado?

factText: US National Weather Service Des Moines Iowa ISSUES a WINTER STORM WARNING effective 5A THURSDAY 2020-04-16 until 7A FRIDAY 2020-04-17 for 🔹Iowa counties: Adams-Appanoose-Clarke-Davis-Decatur-Lucas-Monroe-Ringgold-Taylor-Union-Wapello-Wayne This WARNING replaces the Winter Storm Watch issued earlier. Winter Storm Warning has been issued for Wapello, Union, Appanoose, Clarke, Decatur, Lucas, Monroe, Adams, Taylor, Davis, Wayne, Ringgold until Apr 17 7:00AM. Upgraded to Winter Storm Warning.

An EF1 and an EF2 tornado were confirmed in Clarke County while an EF1 tornado occurred in Lauderdale County. Though this map only covers the Southeast, several tornadoes were confirmed in Texas and two were confirmed in Maryland. Mississippi had its largest tornado in history on Easter Sunday. We had confirmed tornadoes in Neshoba, Kemper, Newton, Clarke, Jasper, and Scott counties in East Mississippi.
35 deaths have been reported in the deep south as the cleanup from the Easter Tornado Outbreak continues!
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-016_general_What news outlets are reporting on {event} and what are they saying?
